values.description: Use a simple user/password based authentication.

properties.name: endpoints.actuator.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.actuator.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.actuator.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.auditevents.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.auditevents.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.auditevents.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.auditevents.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.autoconfig.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.autoconfig.id
properties.description:
Endpoint identifier. With HTTP monitoring the identifier of the endpoint is mapped
 to a URL (e.g. 'foo' is mapped to '/foo').

properties.name: endpoints.autoconfig.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.autoconfig.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.beans.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.beans.id
properties.description:
Endpoint identifier. With HTTP monitoring the identifier of the endpoint is mapped
 to a URL (e.g. 'foo' is mapped to '/foo').

properties.name: endpoints.beans.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.beans.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.configprops.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.configprops.id
properties.description:
Endpoint identifier. With HTTP monitoring the identifier of the endpoint is mapped
 to a URL (e.g. 'foo' is mapped to '/foo').

properties.name: endpoints.configprops.keys-to-sanitize
properties.description: Keys that should be sanitized. Keys can be simple strings that the property ends with or regex expressions.

properties.name: endpoints.configprops.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.configprops.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.allow-credentials
properties.description: Set whether credentials are supported. When not set, credentials are not supported.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.allowed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of headers to allow in a request. '*' allows all headers.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.allowed-methods
properties.description:
Comma-separated list of methods to allow. '*' allows all methods. When not set,
 defaults to GET.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.allowed-origins
properties.description:
Comma-separated list of origins to allow. '*' allows all origins. When not set,
 CORS support is disabled.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of headers to include in a response.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.max-age
properties.description:
How long, in seconds, the response from a pre-flight request can be cached by
 clients.

properties.name: endpoints.docs.curies.enabled
properties.description: Enable the curie generation.

properties.name: endpoints.docs.enabled
properties.description: Enable the endpoint.

properties.name: endpoints.docs.path
properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.docs.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.dump.id

properties.description: Enable endpoints.

 to a URL (e.g. 'foo' is mapped to '/foo').

properties.name: endpoints.health.mapping
properties.description:
Mapping of health statuses to HttpStatus codes. By default, registered health
 statuses map to sensible defaults (i.e. UP maps to 200).

properties.description: Endpoint URL path.

properties.name: endpoints.health.sensitive
properties.description: Mark if the endpoint exposes sensitive information.

properties.name: endpoints.health.time-to-live
properties.description: Time to live for cached result, in milliseconds.

properties.name: endpoints.heapdump.path

Endpoint identifier. With HTTP monitoring the identifier of the endpoint is mapped

properties.description: JMX domain name. Initialized with the value of 'spring.jmx.default-domain' if set.

properties.description: Enable JMX export of all endpoints.

properties.name: endpoints.jmx.static-names
properties.description:
Additional static properties to append to all ObjectNames of MBeans representing

properties.name: endpoints.jmx.unique-names
properties.description: Ensure that ObjectNames are modified in case of conflict.

properties.description: Arbitrary properties to add to the info endpoint.

properties.description:
Jolokia settings. These are traditionally set using servlet parameters. Refer to

properties.name: management.add-application-context-header
properties.description: Add the "X-Application-Context" HTTP header in each response.

properties.name: management.address
properties.description: Network address that the management endpoints should bind to.

properties.name: management.cloudfoundry.enabled
properties.description: Enable extended Cloud Foundry actuator endpoints.

properties.name: management.cloudfoundry.skip-ssl-validation
properties.description: Skip SSL verification for Cloud Foundry actuator endpoint security calls.

properties.name: management.context-path
properties.description: Management endpoint context-path.

properties.name: management.health.cassandra.enabled
properties.description: Enable cassandra health check.

properties.name: management.health.couchbase.enabled
properties.description: Enable couchbase health check.

properties.name: management.health.db.enabled
properties.description: Enable database health check.

properties.name: management.health.defaults.enabled
properties.description: Enable default health indicators.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.enabled
properties.description: Enable disk space health check.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.path
properties.description: Path used to compute the available disk space.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.threshold
properties.description: Minimum disk space that should be available, in bytes.

properties.name: management.health.elasticsearch.enabled
properties.description: Enable elasticsearch health check.

properties.name: management.health.elasticsearch.indices
properties.description: Comma-separated index names.

properties.name: management.health.elasticsearch.response-timeout
properties.description: Time, in milliseconds, to wait for a response from the cluster.

properties.name: management.health.jms.enabled
properties.description: Enable JMS health check.

properties.name: management.health.ldap.enabled
properties.description: Enable LDAP health check.

properties.name: management.health.mail.enabled
properties.description: Enable Mail health check.

properties.name: management.health.mongo.enabled
properties.description: Enable MongoDB health check.

properties.name: management.health.rabbit.enabled
properties.description: Enable RabbitMQ health check.

properties.name: management.health.redis.enabled
properties.description: Enable Redis health check.

properties.name: management.health.solr.enabled
properties.description: Enable Solr health check.

properties.name: management.health.status.order
properties.description: Comma-separated list of health statuses in order of severity.

properties.name: management.info.build.enabled
properties.description: Enable build info.

properties.name: management.info.defaults.enabled
properties.description: Enable default info contributors.

properties.name: management.info.env.enabled
properties.description: Enable environment info.

properties.name: management.info.git.enabled
properties.description: Enable git info.

properties.name: management.info.git.mode
properties.description: Mode to use to expose git information.

properties.name: management.port
properties.description: Management endpoint HTTP port. Use the same port as the application by default.

properties.name: management.security.enabled
properties.description: Enable security.

properties.name: management.security.roles
properties.description: Comma-separated list of roles that can access the management endpoint.

properties.name: management.security.sessions
properties.description:
Session creating policy for security use (always, never, if_required,
 stateless).

properties.name: management.shell.auth.jaas.domain
properties.description: JAAS domain.

properties.name: management.shell.auth.key.path
properties.description: Path to the authentication key. This should point to a valid ".pem" file.

properties.name: management.shell.auth.simple.user.name
properties.description: Login user.

properties.name: management.shell.auth.simple.user.password
properties.description: Login password.

properties.name: management.shell.auth.spring.roles
properties.description: Comma-separated list of required roles to login to the CRaSH console.

properties.name: management.shell.auth.type
properties.description:
Authentication type. Auto-detected according to the environment (i.e. if Spring
 Security is available, "spring" is used by default).

properties.name: management.shell.command-path-patterns
properties.description: Patterns to use to look for commands.

properties.name: management.shell.command-refresh-interval
properties.description: Scan for changes and update the command if necessary (in seconds).

properties.name: management.shell.config-path-patterns
properties.description: Patterns to use to look for configurations.

properties.name: management.shell.disabled-commands
properties.description: Comma-separated list of commands to disable.

properties.name: management.shell.disabled-plugins
properties.description:
Comma-separated list of plugins to disable. Certain plugins are disabled by default
 based on the environment.

properties.name: management.shell.ssh.auth-timeout
properties.description: Number of milliseconds after user will be prompted to login again.

properties.name: management.shell.ssh.enabled
properties.description: Enable CRaSH SSH support.

properties.name: management.shell.ssh.idle-timeout
properties.description: Number of milliseconds after which unused connections are closed.

properties.name: management.shell.ssh.key-path
properties.description: Path to the SSH server key.

properties.name: management.shell.ssh.port
properties.description: SSH port.

properties.name: management.shell.telnet.enabled
properties.description:
Enable CRaSH telnet support. Enabled by default if the TelnetPlugin is
 available.

properties.name: management.shell.telnet.port
properties.description: Telnet port.

properties.name: management.trace.include
properties.description:
Items to be included in the trace. Defaults to request/response headers (including
 cookies) and errors.

properties.name: spring.git.properties
properties.description: Resource reference to a generated git info properties file.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.aggregate.key-pattern
properties.description:
Pattern that tells the aggregator what to do with the keys from the source
 repository. The keys in the source repository are assumed to be period
 separated, and the pattern is in the same format, e.g. "d.d.k.d". Here "d"
 means "discard" and "k" means "keep" the key segment in the corresponding
 position in the source.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.aggregate.prefix
properties.description:
Prefix for global repository if active. Should be unique for this JVM, but most
 useful if it also has the form "a.b" where "a" is unique to this logical
 process (this application) and "b" is unique to this physical process. If you
 set spring.application.name elsewhere, then the default will be in the right
 form.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.delay-millis
properties.description:
Delay in milliseconds between export ticks. Metrics are exported to external
 sources on a schedule with this delay.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.enabled
properties.description: Flag to enable metric export (assuming a MetricWriter is available).

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.excludes
properties.description: List of patterns for metric names to exclude. Applied after the includes.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.includes
properties.description: List of patterns for metric names to include.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.redis.key
properties.description:
Key for redis repository export (if active). Should be globally unique for a
 system sharing a redis repository across multiple processes.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.redis.prefix
properties.description:
Prefix for redis repository if active. Should be globally unique across all
 processes sharing the same repository.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.send-latest
properties.description:
Flag to switch off any available optimizations based on not exporting unchanged
 metric values.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.host
properties.description: Host of a statsd server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.port
properties.description: Port of a statsd server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.prefix
properties.description: Prefix for statsd exported metrics.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.triggers
properties.description: Specific trigger properties per MetricWriter bean name.

properties.name: spring.test.database.replace
properties.description: Type of existing DataSource to replace.

properties.name: spring.test.mockmvc.print
properties.description: MVC Print option.
